Subsection.Text: This Part applies to the marine facilities set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1 and to the port administrations for the ports at which the marine facilities are located.

This Part also applies to every licensed ship’s pilot, as defined in section 2 of the Pilotage Act, having the conduct of a vessel that interfaces with a marine facility set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1 or of a vessel in the waters of a port set out in Part 2 or 3 of that Schedule.

Section.Text: The operator of a marine facility and the port administration shall ensure that the requirements of this Part are met.
Every person shall be a holder of a transportation security clearance if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: require access to a restricted area two and cannot enter the area under any of paragraphs 380(1)(b) to (f) or subsection 380(2) or (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are a licensed ship’s pilot referred to in subsection 501(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are a harbour master or wharfinger appointed under subsection 69(1) of the Canada Marine Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: have security responsibilities, including authorized screening and security guard functions, at the marine facilities and port administrations for the ports referred to in subsection 501(1);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: take applications for transportation security clearances and the applicants’ fingerprints and facial images, which functions are performed on behalf of the Minister and for the purposes of this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: have access to a cruise ship that is interfacing with a restricted area two to provide services, supplies or equipment to the cruise ship or a member of the complement of the cruise ship;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: could cause the failure of a preventive measure, delay the response to a security incident or adversely affect the recovery from a security incident as a result of being assigned or performing any of the following duties, responsibilities or functions:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: access to security information at the marine facility or port,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the supervision of marine facility operations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the creation, alteration, control or maintenance of cargo documentation or crew or passenger lists by a person who

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is present at the marine facility or port, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: has advance access to the documentation or lists, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the planning or directing of the movement of cargo or containers at a container terminal, including their loading and unloading into and from vessels; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: are a seafarer who has submitted an application for a Seafarer’s Identification Document.

Section.Text: The holder of a transportation security clearance who has been issued a restricted area pass shall display the pass on their outer clothing and above their waist, with their photograph or other facial image visible at all times when they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: perform the responsibilities, duties or functions for which a transportation security clearance is required; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter or remain in a restricted area two.

Section.Text: The following persons may submit an application for a transportation security clearance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any person who is required to obtain a transportation security clearance under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any person applying for a job for which a transportation security clearance would be required under these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any seafarer who wishes to voluntarily submit an application for a transportation security clearance.

Subsection.Text: In this section, common-law partner means any person who is cohabiting with the applicant in a relationship of a conjugal nature and has done so for a period of at least one year.
An application for a transportation security clearance shall include the following information and documentation, to be used only for the purposes of sections 508 and 509:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s usual given name used, other given names, surname, all other names used and details of any name changes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s date of birth, gender, height, weight, and eye and hair colour;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant was born in Canada, the number and province of issue of their birth certificate, as well as the original of that certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant was born outside Canada, their place of birth, the port and date of entry, and, in the case of a naturalized Canadian or permanent resident, the number and the original of the applicable certificate issued under the Citizenship Actor the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national, the original of any document that is evidence of their status;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s passport number, including the country of issue and expiry date, or an indication that the applicant does not have a passport;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the addresses of all locations at which the applicant resided during the five years preceding the application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an identification of the applicant’s activities during the five years preceding the application, including the names and street addresses of the applicant’s employers and any post-secondary educational institutions attended;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the dates, destination and purpose of any travel of more than 90 days outside Canada or the United States, excluding travel for government business, during the five years preceding the application;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection (3) respecting the applicant’s spouse or common-law partner, any former spouses or common-law partners;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s fingerprints, taken by or on behalf of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a facial image of the applicant for identification purposes, taken by or on behalf of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed by the marine facility operator or port administration certifying that the applicant requires or will require a transportation security clearance and specifying the reasons for that requirement; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed by the person responsible for taking the fingerprints of the applicant certifying that they have confirmed the identity of the applicant in accordance with paragraph 384(3)(a) at the time of the taking of the fingerprints.

Subsection.Text: The information required with respect to any of the persons referred to in paragraph (2)(j) shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the spouse or common-law partner of the applicant, the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their gender, full given name, surname and, if applicable, maiden name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: their date and place of birth and, if applicable, date of death,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if born in Canada, the number and province of issue of their birth certificate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if born outside Canada, their place of birth, their nationality and the port and date of entry into Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: their present address, if known; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of former spouses and common-law partners with whom the relationship ended within the preceding five years, the information referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i), (ii) and (v).

Subsection.Text: The application for a transportation security clearance shall be valid only if signed by the applicant or, in the case of an applicant who is a minor under the laws of the province where they reside, by a parent or guardian or tutor.

Personal information that is provided in the application for the transportation security clearance and that resulting from the checks and verifications shall not, without the written consent of the individual to whom it relates, be disclosed by the Minister to the government of a foreign state except

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where, in the opinion of the Minister, the public interest in disclosure clearly outweighs any invasion of privacy that could result from the disclosure; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of complying with a subpoena or warrant issued or order made by a court, person or body with jurisdiction to compel the production of information or for the purpose of complying with rules of court relating to the production of information.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), every application for a transportation security clearance shall be submitted on the form supplied by the Minister to the port administration at the port where the applicant works or is a candidate for work or to which the applicant otherwise requires access.
If the port administration is not able to transmit the application in accordance with subsection (3), the application shall be submitted to an official of an office

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: managed by or for an airport authority and that is responsible for the control of the airport’s passes, where the airport authority is able to transmit the application in accordance with a document that evidences the understanding to that effect with the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: operated by the Department of Transport.

Subsection.Text: The port administration or official shall collect the applicant’s information on behalf of the Minister and shall transmit it to the Minister in accordance with the document that evidences the understanding to that effect with the Minister.

Section.Text: On receipt of a fully completed application for a transportation security clearance, the Minister shall conduct the following checks and verifications for the purpose of assessing whether an applicant poses a risk to the security of marine transportation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a criminal record check;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a check of the relevant files of law enforcement agencies, including intelligence gathered for law enforcement purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a Canadian Security Intelligence Service indices check and, if necessary, a Canadian Security Intelligence Service security assessment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a check of the applicant’s immigration and citizenship status.

Section.Text: The Minister may grant a transportation security clearance if, in the opinion of the Minister, the information provided by the applicant and that resulting from the checks and verifications is verifiable and reliable and is sufficient for the Minister to determine, by an evaluation of the following factors, to what extent the applicant poses a risk to the security of marine transportation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the relevance of any criminal convictions to the security of marine transportation, including a consideration of the type, circumstances and seriousness of the offence, the number and frequency of convictions, the length of time between offences, the date of the last offence and the sentence or disposition;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether it is known or there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the applicant

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, activities directed toward or in support of the misuse of the transportation infrastructure to commit criminal offences or the use of acts of violence against persons or property, taking into account the relevance of those activities to the security of marine transportation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been a member of a terrorist group within the meaning of subsection 83.01(1) of the Criminal Code, or is or has been involved in, or contributes or has contributed to, the activities of such a group,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been a member of a criminal organization as defined in subsection 467.1(1) of the Criminal Code, or participates or has participated in, or contributes or has contributed to, the activities of such a group as referred to in subsection 467.11(1) of the Criminal Code taking into account the relevance of these factors to the security of marine transportation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been a member of an organization that is known to be involved in or to contribute to — or in respect of which there are reasonable grounds to suspect involvement in or contribution to — activities directed toward or in support of the threat of or the use of, acts of violence against persons or property, or is or has been involved in, or is contributing to or has contributed to, the activities of such a group, taking into account the relevance of those factors to the security of marine transportation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: is or has been associated with an individual who is known to be involved in or to contribute to — or in respect of whom there are reasonable grounds to suspect involvement in or contribution to — activities referred to in subparagraph (i), or is a member of an organization or group referred to in any of subparagraphs (ii) to (iv), taking into account the relevance of those factors to the security of marine transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the applicant is in a position in which there is a risk that they be suborned to commit an act or to assist or abet any person to commit an act that might constitute a risk to marine transportation security;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether the applicant has had a restricted area pass for a marine facility, port or aerodrome removed for cause; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: whether the applicant has filed fraudulent, false or misleading information relating to their application for a transportation security clearance.

Section.Text: If a criminal charge is outstanding against the applicant that could, if the applicant were convicted, be considered by the Minister under paragraph 509(a), the Minister may decline to process the application until the charge has been disposed of by the courts, in which case the Minister shall advise the applicant in writing.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister intends to refuse to grant a transportation security clearance, the Minister shall advise the applicant in writing to that effect.

The notice shall set out the basis for the Minister’s intention and fix a period of time for the applicant to make written representations to the Minister, which period of time shall start on the day on which the notice is served or sent and shall be not less than 20 days from that day.

The Minister shall not refuse to grant a transportation security clearance until the written representations have been received and considered or before the period of time fixed in the notice has expired, whichever comes first. The Minister shall advise the applicant in writing of any refusal.

The Minister shall establish a period of validity for a transportation security clearance in accordance with the level of risk posed by the applicant determined under section 509, but the period shall not exceed five years.

If the validity period is less than five years, the Minister may extend the period to a total of five years if the Minister determines under section 509 that the holder does not pose a risk to the security of marine transportation.
If a transportation security clearance is suspended and subsequently reinstated, the end of the validity period remains the same as that established at the time of issuance.

Heading.TitleText: Suspension, Reinstatement or Cancellation of Clearances

Section.Text: A marine facility operator or port administration shall immediately notify the Minister in writing when the holder of a transportation security clearance is no longer required by these Regulations to be the holder of a transportation security clearance.

A marine facility operator or port administration shall immediately notify the Minister in writing when they suspend or cancel, for security reasons, a restricted area pass issued to a holder of a transportation security clearance.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may suspend a transportation security clearance on receipt of information that could change the Minister’s determination made under section 509.
Immediately after suspending a transportation security clearance, the Minister shall advise the holder in writing of the suspension.

The notice shall set out the basis for the suspension and shall fix a period of time for the holder to make written representations to the Minister, which period of time shall start on the day on which the notice is served or sent and shall be not less than 20 days from that day.
The Minister may reinstate the transportation security clearance if the Minister determines under section 509 that the holder does not pose a risk to marine transportation security.

The Minister may cancel the transportation security clearance if the Minister determines under section 509 that the holder may pose a risk to marine transportation security or that the transportation security clearance is no longer required. The Minister shall advise the holder in writing of any cancellation.

The Minister shall not cancel a transportation security clearance until the written representations have been received and considered or before the time period fixed in the notice has expired, whichever comes first.

Section.Text: If the Minister refuses to grant or cancels a transportation security clearance, an applicant may submit a new application only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a period of five years has elapsed after the day of the refusal or cancellation; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change has occurred in the circumstances that led to the refusal or cancellation.

Subsection.Text: An applicant or a holder may request that the Minister reconsider a decision to refuse to grant or to cancel a transportation security clearance within 30 days after the day of the service or sending of the notice advising them of the decision.
The request shall be in writing and shall set out the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the decision that is the subject of the request;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds for the request, including any new information that the applicant or holder wishes the Minister to consider; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, and telephone and facsimile numbers of the applicant or holder.

Subsection.Text: On receipt of a request made in accordance with this section, the Minister, in order to determine the matter in a fair, informal and expeditious manner, shall give the applicant or holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the situation warrants, the opportunity to make representations orally or in any other manner; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, a reasonable opportunity to make written representations.

Subsection.Text: After representations have been made or a reasonable opportunity to do so has been provided, the Minister shall reconsider the decision in accordance with section 509 and shall subsequently confirm or change the decision.
The Minister may engage the services of persons with appropriate expertise in security matters to advise the Minister.
The Minister shall advise the applicant or holder in writing of the decision made following the reconsideration.

Section.Text: The Minister shall send to the person at their last known address, by personal service or registered mail, any notices to be given under this Part.
No person shall knowingly file with the Minister a fraudulent application or an application containing false or misleading information in order to obtain a transportation security clearance.

Heading.Label: PART 6
Heading.TitleText: Contravention of Provisions Designated as Violations

Subsection.Text: The contravention of a provision of the Act set out in column 1 of an item of Schedule 2 is designated a violation that may be proceeded with in accordance with sections 33 to 46, 49 and 50 of the Act.
For each violation designated under subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the penalty or range of penalties for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual is set out in column 2, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation is set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an “X” appears in column 4, the violation constitutes a separate violation for each day on which it is continued.

Subsection.Text: The contravention of a provision of these Regulations set out in column 1 of an item of Schedule 3 is designated a violation that may be proceeded with in accordance with sections 33 to 46, 49 and 50 of the Act.
For each violation designated under subsection (1),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the penalty or range of penalties for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual is set out in column 2, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation is set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an “X” appears in column 4, the violation constitutes a separate violation for each day on which it is continued.

Subsection.Text: This section applies to the following documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of violation referred to in paragraph 33(1)(b) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of compliance referred to in section 35 of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of default referred to in subsection 36(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of refusal to issue a certificate of proficiency referred to in subsection 802(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of suspension or cancellation referred to in subsection 14(2) or 805(1).

Subsection.Text: A document may be served on an individual by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: giving a copy to the individual;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: giving a copy to someone who appears to be an adult member of the same household at the last known address or usual place of residence of the individual; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sending a copy by registered mail or courier to the last known address or usual place of residence of the individual or by facsimile transmission to the last facsimile number provided.

Subsection.Text: A document may be served on a person other than an individual by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: giving a copy to one of the person’s officers or agents at the person’s head office or place of business; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sending a copy by registered mail or courier to the head office or place of business of the person or their agent or by facsimile transmission to the last facsimile number provided.

Subsection.Text: A document that is served by facsimile transmission shall include a cover page setting out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address and telephone and facsimile numbers of the sender;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date and time of transmission;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total number of pages transmitted, including the cover page; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and telephone number of a person to contact in the event of transmission problems, if they differ from those provided for the sender.

Subsection.Text: A document that is served by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: registered mail is deemed to have been served on the fourth day after the day on which it was sent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: facsimile transmission is deemed to have been served on the day after the day on which it was sent.

Subsection.Text: Proof of service of a document may be made by showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a document transmitted by facsimile, a proof of transmission produced by the facsimile machine that sets out the date and time of transmission; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, an acknowledgement of service signed by or on behalf of the person served, specifying the date and place of service.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of interpreting tables A-VI/5, A-VI/6-1 and A-VI/6-2 of the STCW Code,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “ship” shall be read to mean “vessel”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “measures and procedures” shall be read to mean “requirements and procedures”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “port facility” shall be read to mean “marine facility”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “ship/port interface” shall be read to mean “vessel/marine facility interface”; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “designating and monitoring restricted areas” shall be read to mean “establishing and monitoring restricted areas”.

Subsection.MarginalNote: References in French version of STCW Code
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of interpreting tables A-VI/5, A-VI/6-1 and A-VI/6-2 of the French version of the STCW Code,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “audits” shall be read to mean “vérifications”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “zones d’accès restreints” shall be read to mean “zones réglementées”.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance of a Certificate of Proficiency

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall issue a certificate of proficiency to a person if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister receives certification from a recognized institution that the person has successfully completed an approved training course;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a certificate of proficiency as a ship security officer, the person has at least 12 months of sea service, calculated in accordance with sections 115, 116 and 118 of the Marine Personnel Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person is at least 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person provides proof that he or she is a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the person meets the standards of medical fitness set out in Division 8 of Part 2 of the Marine Personnel Regulations and has been issued a medical certificate or a provisional medical certificate under that Division; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the person meets the standards of competence required by these Regulations for the performance of the duties associated with the capacities identified in the certificate of proficiency.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(b), the references in subsection 115(3) and section 116 of the Marine Personnel Regulations to “qualifying service” shall be read as references to “sea service”.
The Minister shall issue a certificate of proficiency as a member of the vessel personnel with security responsibilities to a person who commenced sea service before January 1, 2012 if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provides the Minister, no later than June 30, 2014, with a testimonial indicating that the person has undertaken the tasks, duties and responsibilities listed in column 1 of table A-VI/6-2 of the STCW Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has acquired, during the three years preceding January 1, 2014, a total of at least six months of sea service, calculated in accordance with sections 115, 116 and 118 of the Marine Personnel Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is at least 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: provides the Minister with proof that the person is a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: meets the standards of medical fitness set out in Division 8 of Part 2 of the Marine Personnel Regulations and has been issued a medical certificate or a provisional medical certificate under that Division.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall issue a certificate of proficiency as a member of the vessel personnel without security responsibilities to a person who commenced sea service before January 1, 2012 if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provides the Minister, no later than June 30, 2014, with a testimonial indicating that the person has undertaken the tasks, duties and responsibilities listed in column 1 of table A-VI/6-1 of the STCW Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has acquired, during the three years preceding January 1, 2014, a total of at least six months of sea service, calculated in accordance with sections 115, 116 and 118 of the Marine Personnel Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is at least 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: provides the Minister with proof that the person is a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: meets the standards of medical fitness set out in Division 8 of Part 2 of the Marine Personnel Regulations and has been issued a medical certificate or a provisional medical certificate under that Division.

Subsection.Text: Despite section 801, the Minister shall refuse to issue a certificate of proficiency to a person if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person has not met the requirements for the issuance of the certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person has acted fraudulently or improperly or has misrepresented a material fact, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the public interest and, in particular, the record of the person warrant it.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister refuses to issue a certificate of proficiency to a person, the Minister shall notify the person of the refusal. The notice shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds for the refusal; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address at which, and the date, being 30 days after the day on which the notice is given, on or before which, the person may file a request for a review of the refusal.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a course as an approved training course if the Minister determines that it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provides participants with the training necessary to undertake the tasks, duties and responsibilities listed in column 1 of tables A-VI/5, A-VI/6-1 and A-V1/6-2 of the STCW Code and to acquire the knowledge listed in column 2 of those tables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: uses the methods and criteria listed in columns 3 and 4, respectively, of tables A-VI/5, A-VI/6-1 and A-V1/6-2 of the STCW Code to evaluate the participants’ competence to undertake the tasks, duties and responsibilities referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall revoke the approval of a course as an approved training course if, after the results of an independent evaluation made in accordance with section A-I/8.3 of the STCW Code are brought to the attention of the recognized institution that is providing the course, timely action is not taken to correct any deficiencies.

The Minister shall designate a training institution as a recognized institution if the Minister is satisfied that the training institution administers, in accordance with the established practices and the requirements of the domestic and international marine industry, approved training courses for the purpose of providing the training necessary to obtain a certificate of proficiency issued under this Part.
The approved training courses shall be monitored continuously through a quality management system that conforms to Regulation I/8 of the STCW Convention.

The Minister shall revoke the designation of a recognized institution if, after informing the recognized institution that the results of an evaluation conducted by the Minister indicate that the requirements of subsection (1) or (2) are not being met, the Minister is satisfied that timely action has not been taken to correct the deficiencies.
The Minister shall suspend or cancel a person’s certificate of proficiency if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate was obtained by any fraudulent or improper means or a misrepresentation of any material fact;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the public interest warrants it, particularly in view of the person’s record; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s performance of the duties associated with the capacities identified in the certificate constitutes, or is likely to constitute, an immediate threat to marine transportation security.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall cancel a person’s certificate of proficiency if the Minister determines that the person is no longer a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.
If the Minister suspends or cancels a person’s certificate of proficiency, the Minister shall notify the person of the suspension or cancellation. The notice shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds for the suspension or cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address at which, and the date, being 30 days after the day on which the notice is given, on or before which, the person may file a request for a review of the suspension or cancellation.

Subsection.Text: The suspension or cancellation shall not be effective earlier than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a suspension or cancellation on the grounds referred to in paragraph 804(1)(a) or (b), the 30th day after the day on which the person receives the notice; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a suspension or cancellation on the grounds referred to in paragraph 804(1)(c) or subsection 804(2), when the person receives the notice.

Subsection.Text: Notice is considered to be received on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when the person receives the notice, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when any vessel of which the person is the master or a crew member receives the notice.

Section.Text: The Tribunal has jurisdiction in respect of reviews and appeals under sections 807 to 810.

Subsection.Text: A person who is notified under subsection 802(2) or 805(1) may, on or before the date specified in the notice or within any further time that the Tribunal on application allows, file with the Tribunal a written request for a review of the refusal, suspension or cancellation.
A request for a review does not operate as a stay of the refusal, suspension or cancellation.

On application in writing by a person whose certificate of proficiency was suspended or cancelled on any of the grounds referred to in paragraph 804(1)(c) or subsection 804(2), a member of the Tribunal assigned for the purpose may, after giving notice to the Minister and after considering any representations made by the parties, grant a stay of the suspension or cancellation until the review is completed if he or she determines that granting a stay would not constitute a threat to marine transportation security.

On receipt of a request filed under section 807, the Tribunal shall appoint a time and place for the review and shall notify the Minister and the person who filed the request of the time and place in writing.
The assigned member of the Tribunal shall confirm the refusal, suspension or cancellation or refer the matter back to the Minister for reconsideration.
Within 30 days after the day on which a determination is made under subsection 808(2), the certificate holder may appeal the determination to the Tribunal.
A party who does not appear at a review hearing is not entitled to appeal a determination unless they establish that there was sufficient reason to justify their absence.
The appeal panel of the Tribunal assigned to hear the appeal shall dismiss it or refer the matter back to the Minister for reconsideration.

Section.MarginalNote: Decision to remain in effect pending reconsideration
Section.Text: If a matter is referred back to the Minister for reconsideration under subsection 808(2) or 809(3), a suspension or cancellation remains in effect until the reconsideration is concluded. However, the member who made the determination or the appeal panel, after considering any representations made by the parties, may grant a stay of the suspension or cancellation until the reconsideration is concluded if the member or panel determines that granting a stay would not constitute a threat to marine transportation security.
No person shall possess a certificate of proficiency except the person to whom it was issued or the person’s representative.
The holder of a certificate of proficiency shall produce it on the Minister’s request.
If a certificate of proficiency is suspended or cancelled, the person to whom it was issued shall return it to the Minister on request.
